Idea:

 First, Convert string s to a char array,than create a StringBuffer and init it. Now we need add char with the rules. At last, convert it back to a String and outpt.

entry.title: 169. Majority Element
entry.content:
Problem:

Given an array of size n, find the majority element. The majority element is the element that appears more than ⌊ n/2 ⌋ times. You may assume that the array is non-empty and the majority element always exist in the array.

Idea:

 The majority element appears more than [n/2] means that the middle number of the sorted array must be the majority number.

entry.title: 167. Two Sum II - Input array is sorted
entry.content:
Problem:

Given an array of integers that is already sorted in ascending order, find two numbers such that they add up to a specific target number. The function twoSum should return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to the target, where index1 must be less than index2. Please note that your returned answers (both index1 and index2) are not zero-based. You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution and you may not use the same element twice.

Idea:

 Find the two number from the tail and head of this array, if nums[l] plus nums[h] is bigger than target number, than h minus 1, but if samller than target number, l plus 1, until we get nums[l] plus nums[h] equals targte number, return an array contains l and h.

entry.title: 155. Min Stack
entry.content:
Problem:

Idea:

 The idea is to store the gap between the min value and the current value. The problem for my solution is the cast. I have no idea to avoid the cast. Since the possible gap between the current value and the min value could be Integer.MAX_VALUE-Integer.MIN_VALUE;

entry.title: 122. Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II
entry.content:
Problem:

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a given stock on day i. Design an algorithm to find the maximum profit. You may complete as many transactions as you like (ie, buy one and sell one share of the stock multiple times). However, you may not engage in multiple transactions at the same time (ie, you must sell the stock before you buy again).

Idea:

 Just as the before problem, reverse the time line,because when the sell prices were bigger than the purcharse prices, there will be profit during this transaction. Accumulated profits will be what we need.

Java Code:
entry.summary:
Problem:

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a

entry.title: 121. Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
entry.content:
Problem:

Say you have an array for which the ith element is the price of a given stock on day i. If you were only permitted to complete at most one transaction (ie, buy one and sell one share of the stock), design an algorithm to find the maximum profit.

Idea:

 This could be a easy dynamic programming ploblem. I’d like to use a for-loop to calculate the max difference and return the max-difference.

Java Code:

class Solution {    public int maxProfit(int[] prices) {        if (prices.length==0) return 0;    int max=0;    int softMin= prices[0];    for (int i=0;i<prices.length;i++) {        if (prices[i]>softMin) {            max=Math.max(max, prices[i]-softMin);        }        else {            softMin = prices[i];        }    }    return max;    }}

entry.title: hexo+next personal setting
entry.content:
Add “Fork me on github”:

 click here to select your favoriate style and copy the link code, like this:

Than open the swig file use vim themes/next/layout/_layout.swig, put the code under <div class="headband"></div> and change the href to your github address.

Add some click effect:

 click here to get the love.js code and copy it. Than use vim thems/next/source/js/src/love.js to create and edit file, copy love.js to this file. And than edit another file use vim thems/next/layout/_layout.swig. At the tail of this file add code like this:

entry.title: 111. Minimum Depth of Binary Tree
entry.content:
Problem:

Given a binary tree, find its minimum depth.

The minimum depth is the number of nodes along the shortest path from the root node down to the nearest leaf node.

Idea:

  Use a recursion, constantly return the shallow children subtree, until the child node equals null.

entry.title: 110. Balanced Binary Tree
entry.content:
Problem:

Given a binary tree, determine if it is height-balanced.

For this problem, a height-balanced binary tree is defined as a binary tree in which the depth of the two subtrees of every node never differ by more than 1.

Idea:

  Use recursion to traverse the left and right nodes at the same time, if node depth between the left and right is no more than 1, we consider it as a balanced binary tree.

Java Code:
entry.summary:
Problem:

Given a binary tree, determine if it is height-balanced.
